multiple_choice.choice: In the mouth with salivary amylase.
In the small intestine with trypsin.
In the large intestine with carboxypeptidase.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Salivary amylase begins starch digestion in the mouth.
Incorrect. Trypsin in the small intestine hydrolyze polypeptides which are smaller then proteins.
Correct. Digestion of proteins begins in the stomach with the enzyme pepsin breaking them down into polypeptides.
Incorrect. Digestion does not occur in the large intestine. Carboxypeptidase is active in the small intestine.
